channel.title: New cheap computer
channel.description: I'm in need of a new cheap, but still decent, computer. I hoping to spend somewhere around $300-400. To be used for programming (multiple IDE/tools, music, ff), gaming (CS, TF2, Crysis? :|), etc. I'm open to any manufacturer, AMD or Intel, ATI or nVidia, etc. I really don't give two shits who made it, as long as it works well. I don't need a monitor, mouse, keyboard or (I think) HDD. Canada plz.

item.title: New cheap computer
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:17, topic:261252”][quote author=Holic link=topic=345007.msg2661984#msg2661984 date=1234252073]
What about this harddrive? http://www.newegg.ca/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822148288
It’s cheaper than the one you posted with a higher capacity and the specs seem to say it’s better, I just know jack shit about this.
[/quote]I agree. Seagate are reliable, i’ve had one for 2 years now (320GB). Whatever you do, avoid Maxtor. The Diamondmax 9-series was probably the worst harddriver i’ve ever had. 3 of them broke on 3 different occasions in less than a year.[/quote]
Weird, I’ve been using Maxtor drives without a problem for around 3 or 4 years.

Read full topic

item.title: New cheap computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’ve always been an nvidia fanboy, still am. (Their drivers, especially for linux, are far superior than ATI’s) I also used to be an AMD fanboy, as I said above, (I do love the amd64 architecture they came out with!, which is implemented in the new intels as well) but the new Intels give you a much better bang for your buck, so I go with them.

Read full topic

item.title: New cheap computer
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Well, I haven’t actually even tried a new intel (<4 years). Just in my experience, the P3 always run really warm, the Celerons run slow and the PM’s run at different clocks every second.

Maybe next year when I get an entire new computer, I might go for Intel/nVidia.

Read full topic

item.title: New cheap computer
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:24, topic:261252”]I still say intel is gay and useless. They always break, the only good thing is the sound/logo on tv.

AMD IMO just sounds better than Intel.

ATI(With AMD) sucks IMO, cause the cards are usually ugly, power hungry and long.
nVidia is good, the cards are sexy, have nice heat sinks and don’t use as much power.[/quote]Don’t be so harsh on other products, i my self was always a AMD/Nvidia fan, until i went with an Intel CPU which was by far the best thing i have ever done, then turned Intel/NVidia, then in the generation AMD/ATI released the 48xx series of cards, i didn’t turn to them but i like them just as much as nvidia, due to they were the underdogs who came out on top (whilst in a very bad money situation).

the 4870 is probably the best value for money card out today. I don’t become a fanboi of 1 brand, whoever brings the best value for money i am usually a fan of, but nvidia has done this for quite awhile now too.

Read full topic

item.title: New cheap computer
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

I still say intel is gay and useless. They always break, the only good thing is the sound/logo on tv.

AMD IMO just sounds better than Intel.

ATI(With AMD) sucks IMO, cause the cards are usually ugly, power hungry and long.
nVidia is good, the cards are sexy, have nice heat sinks and don’t use as much power.

item.title: New cheap computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:11, topic:261252”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=345007.msg2660867#msg2660867 date=1234174369]
@ chrisn2323, yeah you could spend 30$ cheaper, but why wouldent you spend an extra 30$ for double the power. a 4830 is like 2x 9600GT in SLI.

@runescape3dude: that CPU is a heep of shit, and it not better, don’t be stupid.
[/quote]

I see. The manufacturing technology is better on the Intel, but the AMD has more clock cylces. So people running a gayparscape server can host more servers.[/quote]

Actually, not too long ago that used to be the case. When I started building computers you had a choice between an AMD Athlon 2000+ or a Pentium 4 2ghz. The AMD only ran at 1.67ghz, but still outperformed the Intel, and the AMD was cheaper. So the first computers I built had only AMD’s in them. It is a matter of the number of operations performed per clock cycle (ghz only depends on clock cycles).

However, as someone pointed out above, nowadays the Core2duo (or quad) intels outperform their AMD counterparts for the same price. So you get off cheaper and with better performance with Intel, at the moment that is…

Read full topic

item.description:

the CA site is more expensive in HDDs

newegg.ca

Western Digital Blue WD2500AAJS 250GB 7200 RPM 8MB Cache SATA 3.0Gb/s...

Buy Western Digital Blue WD2500AAJS 250GB 7200 RPM 8MB Cache SATA 3.0Gb/s 3.5" Internal Hard Drive Bare Drive with fast shipping and top-rated customer service. Newegg shopping upgraded ™

that’s the best outcome i could come up with, i assume you don’t want 160gig or less?

item.title: New cheap computer
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Western Digitals tend to start making funny noises after 2+ years of use. They still work, but it’s not exactly confidence inspiring. I’ve had a 320gb Seagate for a year now, and it still runs as well as the day I got it.

Read full topic

@Speljohan: depends on the batch, i have had a shitty Seagate, and right now Seagate’s rep is getting owned by faulty HDD’s, Samsung SpinPoints seem to be doin good, western digital are decent too, but all hard drives can fuck up at some stage.[/quote]Mine is a SpinPoint so i guess that’s correct. I’m not touching a Maxtor again though. I couldn’t even get support for it cause it was 2 years old. Not keeping support longer than 2 years is just ridiculous

item.title: New cheap computer
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:11, topic:261252”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=345007.msg2660867#msg2660867 date=1234174369]
@ chrisn2323, yeah you could spend 30$ cheaper, but why wouldent you spend an extra 30$ for double the power. a 4830 is like 2x 9600GT in SLI.

@runescape3dude: that CPU is a heep of shit, and it not better, don’t be stupid.
[/quote]

I see. The manufacturing technology is better on the Intel, but the AMD has more clock cylces. So people running a gayparscape server can host more servers.[/quote]

Don’t talk about things you don’t know what your talking about.

a better cpu for hosting is one that processes tasks faster, according to results an Intel E8400/E6850 @ 3.0ghz will process tasks 80% faster than the equivalent to AMD (AMD Athlon X2 6000+ 3.0ghz)

you’d be surprised how much faster the core 2 duo’s are compared to the athlons.

Read full topic
